H0.text: A mixture is the result when hydrogen and chlorine chemically bond to form hydrogen chloride.

H1.text: A solution is the result when hydrogen and chlorine chemically bond to form hydrogen chloride.

H2.text: A compound results when hydrogen and chlorine chemically bond to form hydrogen chloride.

H3.text: A precipitate is the result when hydrogen and chlorine chemically bond to form hydrogen chloride.

A4.text: The compound hydrogen chloride has the chemical formula HCl and as such is a hydrogen halide.

A5.text: Hydrogen chloride is a diatomic molecule, consisting of a hydrogen atom H and a chlorine atom Cl connected by a polar covalent bond.
